articles.description: Follow live text and radio commentary as Manchester United host rivals Liverpool in the Premier League.
articles.title: Premier League: Man Utd v Liverpool - build-up & team news

articles.description: Mohamed Salah scores a late penalty for Liverpool to rescue a point for the Reds against Manchester United at Old Trafford.
articles.title: Late Salah penalty rescues Liverpool draw at Man Utd

articles.description: World champion Mathieu van der Poel defends his Paris-Roubaix title with a stunning solo ride to win in record time.
articles.title: Paris-Roubaix: World champion Mathieu van der Poel defends his title

articles.description: Almost one year after starting, Russ Cook - more widely known as the Hardest Geezer - completes his challenge to run the length of Africa.
articles.title: Hardest Geezer: British man Russ Cook completes run across Africa

articles.description: Rabbi Matondo's stoppage-time goal prevents Celtic extending their Scottish Premiership lead as Rangers come from behind twice to draw six-goal Old Firm classic.
articles.title: Rangers strike at death to draw chaotic Old Firm epic

articles.description: Mercedes team principal Toto Wolff painted a bleak but realistic picture of the Formula 1 season ahead after the Japanese Grand Prix.
articles.title: Japanese Grand Prix 2024: 'No one is going to catch Max this year'

articles.description: Follow live text updates as Peterborough United play Wycombe Wanderers in the EFL Trophy final.
articles.title: EFL Trophy final LIVE: Peterborough United v Wycombe Wanderers score & updates

articles.description: Roma defender Gianluca Mancini faces an investigation after waving a flag depicting Lazio fans as 'rats'.
articles.title: Roma's Mancini investigated for Lazio 'rat' flag

articles.description: Northampton Saints score four excellent tries to down Munster and set up a Champions Cup quarter-final against the Bulls.
articles.title: Ruthless Northampton beat Munster in absorbing game

articles.description: Ulster came from behind to beat Montpellier in the last 16 of the European Challenge Cup after the French side had Paul Willemse sent off and were shown three second-half cards.
articles.title: Ulster reach last eight as Willemse sent off
